There is dismay among some members of the Assembly about a proposal to change their title to VAT ( a member of the Welsh Parliament ) .
The reason was plans to change the name of the National Assembly in the Welsh Parliament .
Members of all parties to the National Assembly are concerned that they may be exposed to mockery .

Note for the reader : “ twp ” in Welsh means “ coated ” and “ pwp ” means “ cake ” .
A meeting member of Plaid Cymru said that the group as a whole was " unhappy " and proposed alternatives .
A Welsh Conservative said that his group would be “ open ” to a change of name , but pointed out that it is only a short verbal leap from “ MWP ” ( a member of the Welsh Parliament ) to “ Muppet . ”
Note : The Welsh letter W is pronounced like the U in English .

The Commission of the National Assembly , which is currently working on a bill for name changes , said : ‘ The final decision on the name of the members of the National Assembly is , of course , up to the members themselves . ’
With the Government of Wales Act 2017 , the Welsh Parliament was given the opportunity to change its name .
In June last year , the Commission published the results of a public hearing on the proposals which gave broad support to the change in names in the Welsh Parliament .
On the issue of the title of the meeting members , the Commission preferred Welsh MPs or WMPs , but the MWP option received the most support in a public consultation .

Members of the Welsh Parliament seem to be proposing alternative options , but the fight to reach a consensus could be a headache for Chairman Elin JONES , who is expected to present a bill for these changes in the coming weeks .
The reform legislation will include changes to the way the Assembly operates , including rules for disqualification of members of the Welsh Parliament and the design of the Auschuss system .
The members of the National Assembly can decide how to call them in the debate on the law .
Macedonians hold a referendum on changing the name of the country .

Independent schools in Scotland have a track record of top academic quality , which continued in 2018 with outstanding auditing results , as well as individual and group success in sport , art , music , and other joint ventures .

With over 30,000 students across Scotland , these schools , represented by the Scottish Council of Independent Schools ( SCIS ) , are striving to offer their students and parents the best level of service .
Independent schools are designed to prepare students – for further education , even at universities , for their professional careers , and for their role as global citizens .
In the education sector , we have the opportunity to develop and implement a tailor-made school curriculum , noting that modern languages are still popular and desirable in schools .
Nelson Mandela once said this : “ When you talk to a person in the language he understands , you reach his mind . ”
When you speak with him in his own language , he gets to his heart . ”
This impressively illustrates that we cannot rely only on the English language if we want to build relationships and trust with people from other countries .
This year ’ s test results show that languages are at the top of the tables with the highest levels of existence in independent schools .
68 percent of students who have studied foreign languages have reached the so-called “ Higher grade A ” higher class A .

The data collected by the SCIS ’ s 74 member schools showed that 72 % of students reached a “ Higher grade A ” in Mandarin , while the students who learned German , French , and Spanish were 72 , 69 , and 63 .
This shows that independent schools in Scotland promote foreign languages as essential skills that children and young people will undoubtedly need in the future .
Language subjects have the same status in independent schools ’ curricula and elsewhere as MINT subjects ( mathematics , information technology , science , and technology ) .
A 2014 survey by the UK Employment and Qualifications Commission found that 17 % of the reasons why employers had difficulty filling vacancies are attributable to a lack of language skills .
Therefore , language skills are becoming increasingly necessary in order to prepare young people for their professional future .
With more promising employment opportunities that require languages , these skills are essential in a globalised world .
Regardless of the career that someone chooses when he has learned a second language , he will have a real advantage in the future with a lifelong ability like this .
With the ability to communicate directly with people from abroad , a multilingual person will automatically be ahead of competitors .

According to a YouGov survey of more than 4,000 adults in the UK in 2013 , 75 % were unable to speak a foreign language well enough to talk , and French is the only language spoken with a two-digit percentage , 15 % .
That is why the current investment in language teaching is important for today 's children .
When children learn to speak several languages – particularly those of developing countries – they will later have better chances of finding meaningful employment in the labour market .
Schools in Scotland are different in terms of language .
Some schools focus on classical modern languages , while other languages that are most important to Britain in 2020 , such as Mandarin or Japanese .
Whatever your child is interested , there will always be a number of languages available in independent schools , with teachers specialized in this field .
Independent schools in Scotland want to provide a learning environment that prepares children well , and they should be given the necessary tools for their success , whatever the future may bring .
In today ’ s global business world , languages remain undeniably important for the country ’ s future , and this must also be reflected in education .
Indeed , modern languages should really be regarded as “ international communication skills . ”
Independent schools will continue to offer this choice , diversity and top quality to young people in Scotland .

Syria is ' ready for the return of refugees ' , says the Foreign Minister
Syria says it is ready for the voluntary return of refugees and appeals to help rebuild the country , which has been devastated by more than seven years of war .
Foreign Minister Walid al-Mouem said to the United Nations General Assembly that conditions in the country are improving .
Today , the situation on the ground is more stable and secure thanks to the progress made in the fight against terrorism ,  he said .
The government continues to rehabilitate areas destroyed by terrorists in order to restore normality .

All the conditions are now in place for the voluntary return of refugees to the country that they had to leave due to terrorism and unilateral economic measures aimed at their daily lives and livelihoods .
The UN estimates that more than 5.5 million Syrians have fled the country since the war began in 2011 .
A further six million people still in the country need humanitarian aid .
Al-Mouem said that the Syrian regime would welcome aid in rebuilding the devastated country .
But he stressed that he would not accept conditional support or assistance from countries that financed the uprising .
